result.execSummary:
Nicole M Blight was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Nicole M Blight was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole M Blight

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Nicole M Blight
Current: 3979 S 76th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53220 United States  (Effective: 07-10-2014)
Prior: 515 W/ Moreland Blvd C/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: June 9, 2014 Review Hearing.  Defendant no longer residing in the Waukesha County Jail.
Defendant by Lake County, Illinois on May 28, 2014.
Warrant for Commitment,   signed by Judge Donald J. Hassin, Jr.
Waiver of Extradition,   signed by Judge Donald J. Hassin, Jr.
Review hearing on June 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Nicole M Blight in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Bryan C Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State of IL seeks the defendant on this case.  Bail in IL is $50,000 cash.  Defendant waives her right to an extradition hearing.  Court signs warrant for committment.  Defendant to be turned over to the proper authorities from Illinois.  Court will set a review date.  Cash bail set at $10,000.   Standard conditions apply.  Court signs the waiver of extradition.  Review hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Nicole M Blight in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Mary C Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No bail has been set.  Court to address the INIT appearance tomorrow.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
